intro: Adenolinum montanum, commonly known as the mountain adenolinum, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with colorful, tubular flowers that attract specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is highly sensitive to environmental changes. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect this unique species from further decline.
